fields.description:

The first macro on the page is mangled, no matter if it is in between a numbered header or underneath

fields.description:
Hi,

In my on-demand Confluence I have a license for 50 users (51 if you count the system user). The e-mails I receive when new users sign up all say that I now have a total of 9 users out of a maximum of 51.

Before it reached 9 users, the number was correct. but for some reason it stopped counting when it reached 9 users.

The same number (9) is shown under License Details in Confluence Admin.
fields.summary: E-mail on user signup shows wrong number of total users

I've changes this to "Koert Klomp". In JIRA this all works OK. However, in Confluence I now have two users named "Koert Klomp [Administrator]", both with the same user name. Is it possible that the full name is changed in Confluence too and that one of the users is removed?

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce

# Make sure you have cloud conversions set up (this is making its way to prod soon)
## To set this up manually you need an OD instance with: Document Conversion Library + Confluence Document Conversion Library + Cloud Conversions Enabler
# Create a page with 100 attachments - even small .txt files will do
# Save the page
# Confluence starts sending the files over to DocTape
# Some files fail with the following exception coming from core

{noformat}
2015-01-09 12:23:08,658 ERROR [pool-1321-thread-1] [atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultAttachmentManager] getAttachmentData Could not find data for attachment: Attachment: SHINFUJI_1020_19-24OCT1014_FUJI-TOKYO copy 3.docx v.1 (2523901) sysadmin - com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.filesystem.AttachmentDataFileSystemException: No such file for Attachment: SHINFUJI_1020_19-24OCT1014_FUJI-TOKYO copy 3.docx v.1 (2523901) sysadmin
{noformat}

Here's what's going on in the plugin:

* The plugin is listening for {{AttachmentCreateEvent}}
* Core triggers the event *after* the file is written to disk
* The plugin adds the attachment to a queue to be sent to the doctape service
* An executor picks up the work and attempts to get an InputStream to the file via {{AttachmentManager#getAttachmentData(Attachment)}}
* Core logs the above error and returns us a {{null}}

I suspect it might be related to http://bugs.java.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=5003595
fields.summary: Cannot find attachment data intermittently in OnDemand

fields.description:
When viewing all the blog posts for a given month, Confluence will list all the posts from that month in one page. For busy spaces this can mean hundreds or thousands of full blog posts being rendered in one go, and this can cause both client-side and server-side performance problems.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to a blog post that has many other blogs posted in the same space in the same month.
# Click the name of the month in the breadcrumb.

h3. Expected result
It should only show 15 blog posts at a time, with pagination (i.e. the same behaviour when you [view all blog posts in a space|https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewrecentblogposts.action?key=SUPPORT]).

h3. Actual result
You will see [all blog posts for that month rendered|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/SUPPORT/2013/08], with no pagination.

h3. Workaround
Set the "Maximum Number of Blog Posts" to other value other than 100
fields.summary: No limit to number of blog posts shown in monthly view

fields.description:
The Chart Macro allows 'Tables' in the configuration options but does not save them correctly to a page.

*Expected:*
If you add the macro and add two tables and set the 'Table' value to 1 - the preview results show the chart of the single table.  Saving will render the chart as shown in the display.

*Actual:*
The preview results show the chart of the single table.  Saving will render the chart with results from *both* tables. Example attached.
fields.summary: Chart Macro doesn't honour previewed data upon save

fields.description:
When the 'content' parameter of the 'Blog Posts' macro is set to 'excerpts', links within the blog post are displayed as plain text, instead of hypertext. While when the 'content' parameter is set to 'entire' hypertext links are shown.

h4.Steps to reproduce
# Create a blog post with a link on its body
# Add the Blog Posts macro to a page
# Set the macro 'content' parameter to 'excerpts'
# Save the page

h4.Workaround
Use the 'content' parameter as 'entire', if possible.
fields.summary: Excerpts on Blog Posts macro display links as plain text

*Problem:*
* The _licensed-confluence users memberships are exported and cause problems when importing.

*Workaround:*
* Edit the file entities.xml inside the backup and remove "_" from "_licensed-confluence" 2 appearances (make sure to re-zip placing files in the root of the zip) and import again.

*Note*: This may also occur for the "atlassian-addons" group. The workaround is the same (remove the dash from both instances of the group name).

fields.summary: OnDemand Confluence attempting to roll back page history causes an error

fields.description:
If an instance has the Workbox add-ons disabled in their account, backspace/delete no longer works in the Confluence Editor.

As a workaround, please ensure that the _Workbox Host Plugin (com.atlassian.mywork.mywork-confluence-host-plugin)_  is enabled and that _/plugins/servlet/myworkserviceselector.action_ is set to _displays in-app notifications_ (the default).

*To OnDemand customers, please open a support case to have Atlassian support enable these add-ons for you.*
fields.summary: Clone: Backspace or delete no longer works in Confluence Editor with Chrome and  Workbox disabled

fields.description:
Hi,

when I am adding/editing a Confluence page and don't select the "notify watchers" checkbox (sorry, I am using the german version so I am not sure how it is called in english), the HipChat room is notified.
I think it is expected, that the HipChat room is just a watcher, like everybody else?


I am using the OnDemand instance, and it happens in the current version (not sure about the version).
fields.summary: Confluence posts to HipChat even when "Notify watchers" is not selected

fields.description: When the Change History macro and the JIRA Issue/Filter macro are used together on the same Confluence page, the text in the JIRA Issue/Filter table can overflow from the page. A long text is not wrapped and the width of the column is fixed by the length of the text.
fields.summary: Change History macro causes table display issues

fields.description:
Thumbnails for images with spaces in their name do not appear at all. The thumbnail system seems to render the space as a '+' which results in a page not found error, whereas the actual attachments use '%20' which seems to work.

*Workaroud*:
 
As workaround users can browse through the attachments section (Tools > Attachments) of the page, and for the attachment you have a space on it (in example: my file.jpg), click in properties and change the file name (so for the my file.jpg you could rename it to myfile.jpg). The image should display fine after that.
fields.summary: Thumbnails do not appear for images with spaces in the name

fields.description:
For some product requirements pages, page property 'Status' is not showing in separate column. (see screenshot) 

I've tried to use default product requirements template, created new page and it didn't help.
Yesterday I was showing in separate column but today I noticed it showing in one column even I didn't change anything.
fields.summary: Product requirements widget shows duplicate columns

fields.description:
In Confluence, when we create or edit a page, if we paste (writing won't work) a link ending in backslash we receive the following error on saving the page:
!confluence_link_error.png|thumbnail!

It reads:
{panel}
The following error(s) occurred:
The editor content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 538. Parser message: Unexpected character '=' (code 61) (expected a name start character) at \[row,col \{unknown-source\}\]: \[1,538\]
{panel}

It seems that Confluence is attempting to generate the link with the backslash, which is considered an invalid character.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create or edit a Confluence page
# Copy the following text into it
{noformat}
http://thisisatest.atlassian.com\
{noformat}
# Attempt to save

*Expected outcome*
# The page is saved
# Either the link is not created or it is created up until the backslash, not including it

*Actual outcome*
# The error happens
# The page is not saved and the customer is uncertain why.

*Workaround*
# Place the cursor on top of the link
# In the window that pops up, click 'Unlink'
# Save the page
fields.summary: Confluence is showing an error when saving with links created on pasting

fields.description:
h3. **Current Behaviour**
ORDER By condition is ignored in JIRA issue macro in Confluence

h3. **Expected Behaviour**
The issues displayed by the JIRA issue macro should be exact to how the filter result is displayed in JIRA

h3. **Steps to reproduce**
# Create and save issue filter from JIRA issue navigator, sample JQL: *{{project = PROJECT_KEY ORDER BY key ASC, summary DESC}}*
# Create a Confluence page
# Add a JIRA Issue macro in a Confluence page
# Use the filter for the search i.e {{filter=xxxx}}, where xxxx is the filter id
# Save the page

h3. **Workaround**
Use the JQL directly in the JIRA issue macro search
fields.summary: ORDER By condition is not respected for JIRA issue Macro

fields.description:
it ends up just returning spaces which are anon-accessible.

The hibernate query being built is: 
{code}select distinct space from SpacePermission as perm inner join perm.space as space where ((perm.userSubject is null and perm.group is null)) and perm.type = :permission order by space.name, space.key{code}

To reproduce, call must be made with a user context where the user is not in confluence-administrators (as this appears to skip the permission check).

Tested on two versions, but has likely been in the wild for ages.
fields.summary: ConfluenceInternalHostApplication.getLocalEntities() does not return entries for spaces which the user can see

fields.description:
If two users go to create a new page from the same template at the same time an "x person is already editing this page, your changes will be merged later" message appears.

This is incorrect as the two pages are 99% likely to be saved with different content filled in to them. 

We use part of our system as a form submission system and having this message falsely alarm users that their form will be merged with someone else just because they're concurrently utilising the same template is wrong.
fields.summary: Concurrent Editing From Template

fields.description:
h5.Steps to reproduce:

- Add a new File List blueprint.
- Drag and drop multiple PDF files which has lots of pages (more than 3 PDF files) all at once.
- After the upload is done check the PDF preview.

You will notice that some preview will mix the pages from different PDF files rather than actual file being previewed. Openening the PDF file in the browser or downloading it doesn't have any trouble, just the preview that's mixing pages from different PDF files.

h5. Workaround:

Upload the files one by one, rather than bulk upload.
fields.summary: Uploading multiple PDF files in File List blueprints causes file preview to mix pages

fields.description:
The summary says it all really. The functions listed below can be used on our confluence service even though we have Anonymous API Access disabled (check box not checked in admin control panel). This is an issue when it comes to confluence sites that have sensitive user or group information.

*Functions in question*:
getUser
getUserInformation
hasGroup
getServerInfo

*Information that can be obtained from each*:
getUser - User's email, full name, name, url
getUserInformation - id, content, creation date, last modifier name, username, creator name, last modification date, and version of user
hasGroup - whether a group exists in a confluence instance or not
getServerInfo - obtain major version, build id, minor version, development build, and patch level

*System Info*:
Atlassian Confluence OnDemand
majorVersion:5
buildId:4332
minorVersion:1
developmentBuild:true
patchLevel:0

This issue also occurs on previous versions of Confluence.
* 3.5.16

When saving a page with a PDF that has been included on the page using the ! exclamation mark, then the error "Failure when converting editor format to storage format" is shown and the page cannot be saved.

# Attach a PDF
# Insert
# Type '!' to embed pdf widget and select file uploaded above

fields.description:
h3. Issue

If we use words such as *RS-232*, *DB-9* or *XYZ-1234455* Confluence creates a link to JIRA. Even if we don't have JIRA projects with 'RS', 'DB' or 'XYZ' keys.

It would be nice to be able to prevent these links from being auto-created (without having to use workarounds all the time).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page
# Place a title and type 'RS-232' in the page content
# Save the page
# 'RS-232' appears as a link pointing to a JIRA Issue that doesn't exist

h3. Workaround

# Create a page
# Place a title and start typing '{' then type 'No Format' and insert the macro
# Type 'RS-232' inside the macro
# Save the page
# 'RS-232' appears normal - no link

*OR*

Instead of typing 'RS-232', can also use:
- Rs-232
- rs-232
fields.summary: Dashed word in Confluence automatically creates a link to a non-existent JIRA issue

fields.description:
On a Confluence and JIRA OnDemand instance view a page, at the same time tail the apache logs like so:
{noformat}
aalog | grep /rest/gadgets/1.0/g
127.0.0.1 - - [24/Jul/2014:16:34:44 +1000] "GET /rest/gadgets/1.0/g/feed/ HTTP/1.1" 200 35335 37470 "-" "Atlassian-Gadgets-HttpClient"
127.0.0.1 - - [24/Jul/2014:16:34:59 +1000] "GET /rest/gadgets/1.0/g/feed/ HTTP/1.1" 200 35335 67946 "-" "Atlassian-Gadgets-HttpClient"
127.0.0.1 - - [24/Jul/2014:16:35:09 +1000] "GET /rest/gadgets/1.0/g/feed/ HTTP/1.1" 200 35335 64936 "-" "Atlassian-Gadgets-HttpClient"
127.0.0.1 - - [24/Jul/2014:16:36:22 +1000] "GET /rest/gadgets/1.0/g/feed/ HTTP/1.1" 200 35335 77000 "-" "Atlassian-Gadgets-HttpClient"
127.0.0.1 - - [24/Jul/2014:16:39:19 +1000] "GET /rest/gadgets/1.0/g/feed/ HTTP/1.1" 200 35335 70591 "-" "Atlassian-Gadgets-HttpClient"
{noformat}

As above you'll see that the  /rest/gadgets/1.0/g/feed/  URL is hit constantly. In the above case I viewed a page, created a page, viewed the created page and then viewed another page, all of which drove the above action. I am the only user on that instance, and that is the only action I was performing.

The cache is showing:
!Cache Statistics - Confluence 2014-07-24 16-37-21 2014-07-24 16-37-26.png|width=800!

That indicates to me that the cache is not being hit as much as it should.
fields.summary: Confluence loading gadget feed on every page load

fields.description:
Adding more than one existing label to the same Confluence page, after adding the first one (which is always successfully added), when trying to add the second one by clicking over its suggestion after typing its initial letters, takes us to a not found page on JIRA.
*Important:* for this error to happen when adding the second label, it is mandatory to use the Tab key on the keyboard to circle over all links on the page until the cursor returns to the Label field.

Basically, what's missing is the "/wiki/" portion of the URL when selecting the second label, hence, for the system, it is a JIRA link.

*Steps to reproduce:*
1) View Confluence page
2) Press "l" to bring up labels dialog
3) Start typing to add existing label
4) Press down arrow to select a label
5) Press enter twice to add the label
6) Press tab repeatedly until focus returns to the labels-string input tag
7) Start typing to add a second existing label
8) Press down arrow to select a label

*Workaround:*
Use Shift+Tab to return the cursor to the Label field. Do not use multiple tabs to circle over all links until you are back to the Label field.
fields.summary: Selecting an existing second label on a Confluence page takes us to a not found page on JIRA

fields.description:
Affects 5.4-OD-21-016 build 4989. 

Normally SOAP interfaces are very stable, however, it looks like an incompatibility related to *minorEdit* has been introduced recently on the OD development drivers. This needs to be reverted before it makes it into released OD. 

I recall a previous issue a couple of years ago when someone removed a field from the wsdl without realizing the incompatibility this introduced. Even if the field is obsolete, it needs to be left in as  a deprecated field.

{noformat}
/sde/atlassian-cli-3.8.0/atlassian confluence-onDemandDevelopment --action getServerInfo
Confluence version: 5.4.0, build: 4989, url: https://bobswift-test.jira-dev.com/wiki

/sde/atlassian-cli-3.8.0/atlassian confluence-onDemandDevelopment --action addAttachment --space ztable --title @home --content "xxx" --name test 
2    [main] ERROR org.apache.axis.client.Call  - Exception:
org.xml.sax.SAXException: Invalid element in org.swift.common.soap.confluence.RemoteAttachment - minorEdit

fields.description:
h3. ***Summary***
Having unlicensed gliffy breaks Confluence page export causing the page to be *unavailable*.

Looking into the logs, the error with Gliffy enabled is the plugin being unlicensed
{code}
... ... 
WARN [TP-Processor38] [gliffy.plugin.license.PluginLicenseManager] validateMarketplaceLicense Marketplace License maintenance has expired
... ... 
{code}
With Gliffy disabled the error occurs because the data source which is the plugin is not available. 
{code}
... ... 
WARN [TP-Processor7] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ExportWordPageServer] extractImagesFromPage Skipping datasource creation for non-relative url: /wiki/plugins/servlet/confluence/placeholder/unknown-macro?name=gliffy&locale=en_GB&version=2
... ...
{code}

h3. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# Install Gliffy
# Create a Confluence page "A"
# Add a Gliffy macro in the page "A"
# Perform a page export (/)
# Disable/Remove Gliffy add-on from Confluence
# Perform a page import for page "A" (x)

h3. ***Current Behaviour***
The page export is unsuccessful after removing the plugin from the instance.

h3. ***Expected Behaviour***
The page is exported successfully without Gliffy macro content.

h3. ***Workaround***
Remove the macro from the page and export.

h4. Workaround:

Turn off the default space logo in Confluence Admin -> Default Space Logo (the URL should be like this (change <example> with the subdomain of your instance's URL) https://<example>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/configuredefaultspacelogo.action). This will allow spaces to be moved.

*/wiki/rest/mywork
*/wiki/rest/quickreload

even though these requests are supposed to be blocked by the DropIfNotSetupFilter.

From [~richatkins]: 
{quote}
so, we're either not blocking them the right way for an upgrade, or we're doing something else bad when blocking them...
{quote}

fields.description:
When a site backup is imported using the Confluence OnDemand Importer plugin, no Active Objects upgrade tasks are run. 

If the same backup is imported as a site import into a BTF instance (i.e. using the normal restore function), then the upgrade tasks are run as expected.

This was discovered whilst diagnosing CONF-31707. The problem is that the OD Importer plugin runs the import in "incremental" mode, which means the AO settings are not deleted as they normally would be. As such, AO thinks it's already at the latest AO version, even though the data it just imported is not.

The fix for CONF-31707 was to add an import preprocessor which reaches into the plugin settings DAO and manually deletes the AO model version setting corresponding to the Workbox schema. That's a dirty hack. This needs fixing properly, since sooner or later it's going to bite someone else.
fields.summary: AO upgrade tasks not run by OD Importer
Balsamiq not working in Confluence Cloud (OnDemand)

fields.description:
When TC upgrading task is running, if there are incorrects sub-calendars (which do not have parent) exceptions will be  thrown and it will lead to failure of upgrading task.

I found that the root cause of this issue is because there are some incorrect sub-calendar in user's instance. Normally, when TC run upgrading tasks and get an incorrect sub-calendar it will log as an exception, ignore that data and continue with others (using same db transaction). But unfortunately that with Postgres database, it does not allow to re-use the error transaction (other dbs work fine) so from that point, all other interactions with DB will be failed. Team Calendar agreed that this is a bug of their upgrade task so please help to create a bug ticket and assign to them.

Please help to find detail logs from support ticket: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-97818
fields.summary: TC Upgrading tasks failed when there are incorrect sub-calendas and DB is Postgres

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Use the OnDemand-specific "Import Site" option to import a large backup (the one I've been trying to import is 14GB, almost all of it attachments).
# Confluence takes so long to even start displaying the long-running task page that you hit the Nginx 60-second timeout in OnDemand and the import doesn't actually proceed.

Confluence should _immediately_ display the long-running task page so we avoid this issue entirely.

h3. Examples
A long-running task such as Confluence space export (especially the page tree from the custom export option) will get the following errors returned.
{code}
Error Loading Pages
An error was encountered loading page for the space PDM. Please contact your administrator for help.
Gateway Timeout error: url=/wiki/spaces/exportspacetree.action params=key=TEST
{code}

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:

# Get a large Confluence space or site backup (larger than 1.5 GB).
# Upload the files to OnDemand WebDav.
# Try to import the space/site backup to Confluence.

After about a minute of hitting the import button, Confluence OnDemand will show the maintenance page:

!maintenance.png|thumbnail!

But if you access Confluence logs, you can see that the import is actually running fine. This is misleading, as users will think their instance is either down, or the import failed, and they will attempt to re-run the import again which will cause the instance to go out of memory, as the import is run twice.
fields.summary: Large Confluence imports in OnDemand produce misleading timeout error

fields.description:
The error displayed on screen after failing is:
{color:red}Import failed. Check your server logs for more information. User [sysadmin] does not have the required privileges.{color}
The import fails and rolls back.

*Problem:*
When a entities.xml contains a group name with leading or trailing whitespaces the log first shows this error and keeps going:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.user.impl.EntityValidationException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.embedded.InvalidGroupException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.InvalidGroupException: Group name may not contain leading or trailing whitespace
 	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.atlassianuser.EmbeddedCrowdGroupManager.createGroup(EmbeddedCrowdGroupManager.java:144)
 	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
...
{noformat}
Later when giving users the memberships:
{noformat}INFO [Long running task: Importing data] [confluenceimporter.procesors.post.UserPostImportTask] updateGroupMemberships Adding user xxxx to group GroupName with a space at the end {noformat}
a few lines after the last log about memberships we find: 
{noformat}ERROR [Long running task: Importing data] [confluence.importexport.actions.ImportLongRunningTask] runInternal Failure during import
  -- url: /wiki/admin/import/doimportconfluencesite.action | userName: sysadmin | referer: https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/import/importconfluencesite.action | action: doimportconfluencesite
com.atlassian.confluence.core.InsufficientPrivilegeException: User [sysadmin] does not have the required privileges.
 	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserAccessor.addMembership(DefaultUserAccessor.java:165)
...
{noformat}
and checking the entities.xml we find that that particular last GroupName has a trailing whitespace. There might be more than one but it will fail with the first one and rolls back.

*Workaround:*
Manually remove the whitespace on every group appearance in entities.xml and import again
fields.summary: Import fails with groups containing leading or trailing whitespace

fields.description:
There is a persistent XSS vulnerability in the attachment download functionality of Confluence. By uploading a malicious executable file type like SVG (scalable vector graphics with embedded JavaScript), it’s possible for an attacker to execute arbitrary code under the context of the logged in user.

The following screenshot demonstrates this vulnerability being exploited:

!PersistentXSS.PNG!

It's recommended the attachment handling code have a white list of known good mime-types that can be rendered inline. For everything else, the HTTP headers for content-type and content-disposition should be set to “application/x-download” and “attachment;" respectively.
fields.summary: File Attachment persistent XSS

When trying to preview PDF Documents in Confluence using Internet Explorer, users receive an "Ouch! We can't load the PDF" error message

h3. Environment
* Cloud with Windows 7 using IE 11. 
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on a PDF Attachment on a Confluence Page

h3. Expected Results
The lightbox preview displays the PDF Document

h3. Actual Results
Lightbox preview shows "Ouch! We can't load the PDF."
 
h3. Notes
It doesn't happen with already cached files, it seems to only occur when you attempt to download a file for the first time.

h3.Workaround
- Use an alternative browser like Chrome, Firefox, or Safari
- If using Internet Explorer, open the PDF File in a new Window/Tab to open the document directly

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Download atlassian-confluence-5.6-OD-39-039-x64.bin
# Install it.
# Navigate to Atlassian Marketplace.

h6. Observed Behavior
When you open the page, you can see the following error:
{code}
"This version of Confluence is unrecognized by the Atlassian Marketplace. It might be a non-standard build or be too new to appear"

fields.description:
*Steps to produce*
Example: Taken the following space structure:
1. Homepage
-> 2. Subpage
-> 3. Subpage (page label=test)

On 2. Subpage, the content label macro is pointing to label *test* which is 3. Subpage.

*Actual Results*
When exporting the space as HTML and browsing 2. Subpage, the links that were created by the content label macro are pointing to {{/wiki/display/...}} and not to the relevant path in the file system.

*Expected Results*
The links generated shouldn't have this part in the URL {{/wiki/display/...}} and should be relevant to the file system.

*Workaround*
Change the HTML URLs in the exported pages to point to the correct path in the file system
fields.summary: HTML Export Function: Page-Links generated by Content Label Macro point to wrong URL
Unsafe i18n calls

fields.description:
When creating a link to another space using the link formatter, the link breaks when the page name starts with a D.

I attempt to create a link like so: [DA_INFO|dbo:DA_INFO]. When I get to the : D, it is changed to a smiley face (just like here, which is why they're spaced out), and if you finish creating the link, the final link displays the correct text, but creates a link to "dboA_INFO" in the current space.

This does not occur if the page exists and you select the page from the "Link suggestions" dropdown.

This can be worked around by creating the link like so: [DA_INFO|dbo: DA_INFO] - the space between the : and D is stripped out, and link is created successfully.
fields.summary: Link creation breaks when linking to a space and page that starts with a D

fields.description:
Precondition:
User doesn't have log-in in Conf
Google Chrome is launched in EN locale
Atlassian Confluence 4.3

Steps:
1 Run Confluence in Google Chrome
2 Start to log-in
3 Enter e-mail without dog
4 Press Log-in button

AR: "Please enter a valid e-mail address" hint is displayed twice (see the att.)
ER: "Please enter a valid e-mail address" hint MUST be displayed once in this case
fields.summary: "Please enter a valid e-mail address" hint is displayed twice

fields.description:
Clicking the link on a Confluence notification email that states "User A has added 1 file to the page" will duplicate the upload action and send another email to the page watchers stating that "User B has added 1 file to the page". 

If user C clicks on the email notification received from user B, then both users A and B will receive an email notification that "User C has added 1 file to the page"

Note: It's the same attachment in all cases ( notably lucidchart diagrams).


*Steps to reproduce*:

1. UserA: Atach a lucidchart diagram to a confluence page.
2. UserB: Be an watcher of the page/space so that you receive a system activity email ("User A has added 1 file to the page").
3. UserB: Click the notification email and go to the page, perform no other action.
_Loop starts_
4. User A, B or any watcher: Receive a system email that UserB has added the same file to the page.
fields.summary: Confluence notification message loop

fields.description:
When I go to the "Task Report" page in the UI, it shows several tasks (many duplicated) that were deleted from a page "IS Repackaging Project Plan". I've confirmed that these tasks do not exist on that page. Additionally, when I pull my task list through the API these tasks don't appear so I can't even try to delete them through the API. What's more, when I try to close these tasks to get rid of them I get an error saying the change could not be saved (see attached picture). 

Please let me know how we can get these old tasks and duplicate tasks removed from our task list. We recently started piloting the Confluence product and would like to use it for some of our project plans but currently task lists are not usable with this bug and we are having to use a second system to track these.
fields.summary: Deleted tasks still showing up in task report in UI
